title.narrative: 1.3. FAMILY AND COMMUNITY CAPACITY STRENGTHENING TO DEMAND AND PROVIDE SERVICES

description.narrative: Families and communities in 14 high-burden districts are empowered and capacitated to provide and demand basic Maternal, Neonatal, and Child Health (MNCH), HIV/AIDS and nutrition care and services for children., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Child Health, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development (Covid), Immunization, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys, including the most deprived, receive an integrated package of quality and equitable maternal, neonatal and child health (MNCH), HIV/AIDS and nutrition care and services.

sector.narrative: Capacity building for nutrition preparedness and response
Hygiene in emergencies - handwashing facility with soap in communities
Technical assistance - Prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents
